messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] breastfeeding & fertility
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/21/03 11:21:42 AM Central Daylight Time, leschke@shaw.ca writes: I know this was about fertility more than about the eat & eat & eat &
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/21/03 11:21:42 AM Central Daylight Time, leschke@...
writes:
I know this was about fertility more than about the eat & eat & eat & throw
up, but I wanted to mention for the benefit of anyone else experiencing
that. My youngest did that, and my LLL leader friend told me he wanted to
suck more than he wanted to eat. She told me to use the same breast for 3-4
hours, then switch. It made all the difference. He was spending a lot of
time sucking, which he needed, and less time actually "eating".
Tia
########################################

Yes, but didn't you just hate the lopsided boobies? <g> I remember many a
morning when Moly would go through a marathon night nursing I would wake up to
two very different shaped breasts.

~Nancy

He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered
whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
Douglas Adams


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] breastfeeding & fertility
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know this was about fertility more than about the eat & eat & eat & throw up, but I wanted to mention for the benefit of anyone else experiencing that.
messages.messageBody:
> I was exclusively breastfeeding, tandeming 2 yo all night and most of
> the day and still got my period at 7 weeks. I had Niagara Falls milk
> supply and Crispin would eat & eat & eat, throw up, eat & eat & eat,
> throw up, eat & eat & eat, throw up, all day. All night. Warm milk
> bath every morning at 4 AM without fail. Still got my period at 7
> weeks. Grrrr.

I know this was about fertility more than about the eat & eat & eat & throw
up, but I wanted to mention for the benefit of anyone else experiencing
that. My youngest did that, and my LLL leader friend told me he wanted to
suck more than he wanted to eat. She told me to use the same breast for 3-4
hours, then switch. It made all the difference. He was spending a lot of
time sucking, which he needed, and less time actually "eating".
Tia
leschke@...

"Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where
there is no path and leave a trail."
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] breastfeeding & fertility
messages.msgSnippet: I was exclusively breastfeeding, tandeming 2 yo all night and most of the day and still got my period at 7 weeks.  I had Niagara Falls milk supply and Crispin
messages.messageBody:
I was exclusively breastfeeding, tandeming 2 yo all night and most of
the day and still got my period at 7 weeks. I had Niagara Falls milk
supply and Crispin would eat & eat & eat, throw up, eat & eat & eat,
throw up, eat & eat & eat, throw up, all day. All night. Warm milk
bath every morning at 4 AM without fail. Still got my period at 7
weeks. Grrrr.

On Saturday, September 20, 2003, at 10:01 PM,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> << Yes, that's true, but if one breastfeeds in a particular way, the
> average length a woman will go without menstrating and therefore
> ovulating is about 14 months. >>
>
--
Heather, mom to
Harriet 12.15.99
Crispin 01.25.02
heatherette@...
